intro: Restio elsieae, commonly known as the Elsie's reed, is a member of the Restionaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in coastal gardens.
